files.module_docstring:
Configuration module.
====================
Application configuration and constants.

definitions.name: get_config
definitions.docstring: Get the current configuration as a dictionary.
definitions.source_text:
def get_config() -> dict:
    """Get the current configuration as a dictionary."""
    return {
        "app_name": APP_NAME,
        "version": VERSION,
        "debug": DEBUG,
        "max_batch_size": MAX_BATCH_SIZE,
        "default_timeout": DEFAULT_TIMEOUT,
        "required_fields": REQUIRED_FIELDS,
        "valid_types": VALID_TYPES,
        "output_format": OUTPUT_FORMAT,
        "include_timestamp": INCLUDE_TIMESTAMP,
    }

files.module_docstring:
Main application module.
========================
Entry point for the mini application with basic functionality.

definitions.name: Application
Application.__init__
definitions.source_text:
def __init__(self, name: str):
        self.name = name
        self.processor = DataProcessor()
        self.data = []

definitions.name: Application.add_data
definitions.docstring: Add data item to the application.
definitions.source_text:
def add_data(self, item: dict) -> None:
        """Add data item to the application."""
        self.data.append(item)
        print(format_message(f"Added item: {item}"))

definitions.name: add_data
definitions.docstring: Add data item to the application.

def add_data(self, item: dict) -> None:
        """Add data item to the application."""
        self.data.append(item)
        print(format_message(f"Added item: {item}"))

definitions.name: process_data
get_summary
main
definitions.source_text:
def main():
    """Main entry point."""
    app = Application("Mini App")

    # Add some sample data
    app.add_data({"id": 1, "value": 10, "type": "A"})
    app.add_data({"id": 2, "value": 20, "type": "B"})
    app.add_data({"id": 3, "value": 15, "type": "A"})

    # Get and display summary
    summary = app.get_summary()
    print(f"Application Summary: {summary}")

files.module_docstring:
Data processing module.
=======================
Handles data processing and validation operations.

definitions.name: DataProcessor
DataProcessor.__init__
DataProcessor.process_item
definitions.source_text:
def process_item(self, item: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Process a single data item."""
        if not validate_item(item):
            error_msg = f"Invalid item: {item}"
            self.errors.append(error_msg)
            raise ValueError(error_msg)

        # Process the item (add some computed fields)
        processed_item = item.copy()
        processed_item["processed"] = True
        processed_item["double_value"] = item["value"] * 2

        self.processed_count += 1
        return processed_item

definitions.name: DataProcessor.process_batch
DataProcessor.get_stats
DataProcessor.reset
definitions.source_text:
def reset(self) -> None:
        """Reset processor state."""
        self.processed_count = 0
        self.errors.clear()

definitions.source_text:
def process_item(self, item: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Process a single data item."""
        if not validate_item(item):
            error_msg = f"Invalid item: {item}"
            self.errors.append(error_msg)
            raise ValueError(error_msg)

        # Process the item (add some computed fields)
        processed_item = item.copy()
        processed_item["processed"] = True
        processed_item["double_value"] = item["value"] * 2

        self.processed_count += 1
        return processed_item

get_stats
reset
definitions.source_text:
def reset(self) -> None:
        """Reset processor state."""
        self.processed_count = 0
        self.errors.clear()

definitions.name: AdvancedProcessor.get_stats
definitions.source_text:
def get_stats(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
        """Get enhanced processing statistics."""
        base_stats = super().get_stats()
        base_stats["filters_applied"] = self.filters_applied
        return base_stats

__init__.refactor_prompt:
Multiple implementations of `__init__` detected across the codebase.
Recommended action: Refactor into a single canonical implementation.
Strategy:
1. Review all variants and their differences
2. Identify superset of functionality
3. Merge implementations preserving all edge cases
4. Add comprehensive tests covering all use cases
5. Update all call sites to use new implementation
